text: Girolamo Luigi Durazzo (Genoa, May 20, 1739 - Genoa, January 21, 1809) was an Italian politician, belonging to the noble Genoese family of the Durres, a dynasty that gave the Republic of Genoa eight dogi and other illustrious characters. he became a French senator in 1805 when his province was annexed by Napoleon. Entered Pantheon 1809. Category:1739 births Category:1809 deaths Category:Politicians from Genoa
title: Girolamo Luigi Durazzo
